title: Egypt Rights Advocates Appear in Court Amid Global Outcry
sub_head: Arrests have set up a possible clash with the incoming Biden administration
body:
Three prominent Egyptian human-rights defenders appeared in a Cairo terrorism court on Tuesday as a part of a high-profile case that has drawn international pressure to release them.
The three members of the Egyptian Initiative for Personal Rights were arrested in November in a crackdown that sparked outcry from European governments, United Nations officials, members of Congress, and President-elect Joe Bidenâ€™s nominee for secretary of state.
Gasser...
